3284#ifdef PCI_IOBASE
3285struct io_range {
3286 struct list_head list;
3287 phys_addr_t start;
3288 resource_size_t size;
3289};
3290
3291static LIST_HEAD(io_range_list);
3292static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(io_range_lock);
3293#endif
3294
3295/*
3296 * Record the PCI IO range (expressed as CPU physical address + size).
3297 * Return a negative value if an error has occured, zero otherwise
3298 */
3299int __weak pci_register_io_range(phys_addr_t addr, resource_size_t size)
3300{
3301 int err = 0;
3302
3303#ifdef PCI_IOBASE
3304 struct io_range *range;
3305 resource_size_t allocated_size = 0;
3306
3307 /* check if the range hasn't been previously recorded */
3308 spin_lock(&io_range_lock);
3309 list_for_each_entry(range, &io_range_list, list) {
3310 if (addr >= range->start && addr + size <= range->start + size) {
3311 /* range already registered, bail out */
3312 goto end_register;
3313 }
3314 allocated_size += range->size;
3315 }
3316
3317 /* range not registed yet, check for available space */
3318 if (allocated_size + size - 1 > IO_SPACE_LIMIT) {
3319 /* if it's too big check if 64K space can be reserved */
3320 if (allocated_size + SZ_64K - 1 > IO_SPACE_LIMIT) {
3321 err = -E2BIG;
3322 goto end_register;
3323 }
3324
3325 size = SZ_64K;
3326 pr_warn("Requested IO range too big, new size set to 64K\n");
3327 }
3328
3329 /* add the range to the list */
3330 range = kzalloc(sizeof(*range), GFP_ATOMIC);
3331 if (!range) {
3332 err = -ENOMEM;
3333 goto end_register;
3334 }
3335
3336 range->start = addr;
3337 range->size = size;
3338
3339 list_add_tail(&range->list, &io_range_list);
3340
3341end_register:
3342 spin_unlock(&io_range_lock);
3343#endif
3344
3345 return err;
3346}
3347
3348phys_addr_t pci_pio_to_address(unsigned long pio)
3349{
3350 phys_addr_t address = (phys_addr_t)OF_BAD_ADDR;
3351
3352#ifdef PCI_IOBASE
3353 struct io_range *range;
3354 resource_size_t allocated_size = 0;
3355
3356 if (pio > IO_SPACE_LIMIT)
3357 return address;
3358
3359 spin_lock(&io_range_lock);
3360 list_for_each_entry(range, &io_range_list, list) {
3361 if (pio >= allocated_size && pio < allocated_size + range->size) {
3362 address = range->start + pio - allocated_size;
3363 break;
3364 }
3365 allocated_size += range->size;
3366 }
3367 spin_unlock(&io_range_lock);
3368#endif
3369
3370 return address;
3371}
3372
3373unsigned long __weak pci_address_to_pio(phys_addr_t address)
3374{
3375#ifdef PCI_IOBASE
3376 struct io_range *res;
3377 resource_size_t offset = 0;
3378 unsigned long addr = -1;
3379
3380 spin_lock(&io_range_lock);
3381 list_for_each_entry(res, &io_range_list, list) {
3382 if (address >= res->start && address < res->start + res->size) {
3383 addr = address - res->start + offset;
3384 break;
3385 }
3386 offset += res->size;
3387 }
3388 spin_unlock(&io_range_lock);
3389
3390 return addr;
3391#else
3392 if (address > IO_SPACE_LIMIT)
3393 return (unsigned long)-1;
3394
3395 return (unsigned long) address;
3396#endif
3397}
3398
3399/**
3400 * pci_remap_iospace - Remap the memory mapped I/O space
3401 * @res: Resource describing the I/O space
3402 * @phys_addr: physical address of range to be mapped
3403 *
3404 * Remap the memory mapped I/O space described by the @res
3405 * and the CPU physical address @phys_addr into virtual address space.
3406 * Only architectures that have memory mapped IO functions defined
3407 * (and the PCI_IOBASE value defined) should call this function.
3408 */
3409int pci_remap_iospace(const struct resource *res, phys_addr_t phys_addr)
3410{
3411#if defined(PCI_IOBASE) && defined(CONFIG_MMU)
3412 unsigned long vaddr = (unsigned long)PCI_IOBASE + res->start;
3413
3414 if (!(res->flags & IORESOURCE_IO))
3415 return -EINVAL;
3416
3417 if (res->end > IO_SPACE_LIMIT)
3418 return -EINVAL;
3419
3420 return ioremap_page_range(vaddr, vaddr + resource_size(res), phys_addr,
3421 pgprot_device(PAGE_KERNEL));
3422#else
3423 /* this architecture does not have memory mapped I/O space,
3424 so this function should never be called */
3425 WARN_ONCE(1, "This architecture does not support memory mapped I/O\n");
3426 return -ENODEV;
3427#endif
3428}
3429EXPORT_SYMBOL(pci_remap_iospace);
3430
3431/**
3432 * pci_unmap_iospace - Unmap the memory mapped I/O space
3433 * @res: resource to be unmapped
3434 *
3435 * Unmap the CPU virtual address @res from virtual address space.
3436 * Only architectures that have memory mapped IO functions defined
3437 * (and the PCI_IOBASE value defined) should call this function.
3438 */
3439void pci_unmap_iospace(struct resource *res)
3440{
3441#if defined(PCI_IOBASE) && defined(CONFIG_MMU)
3442 unsigned long vaddr = (unsigned long)PCI_IOBASE + res->start;
3443
3444 unmap_kernel_range(vaddr, resource_size(res));
3445#endif
3446}
3447EXPORT_SYMBOL(pci_unmap_iospace);
3448
3449/**
3450 * devm_pci_remap_cfgspace - Managed pci_remap_cfgspace()
3451 * @dev: Generic device to remap IO address for
3452 * @offset: Resource address to map
3453 * @size: Size of map
3454 *
3455 * Managed pci_remap_cfgspace(). Map is automatically unmapped on driver
3456 * detach.
3457 */
3458void __iomem *devm_pci_remap_cfgspace(struct device *dev,
3459 resource_size_t offset,
3460 resource_size_t size)
3461{
3462 void __iomem **ptr, *addr;
3463
3464 ptr = devres_alloc(devm_ioremap_release, sizeof(*ptr), GFP_KERNEL);
3465 if (!ptr)
3466 return NULL;
3467
3468 addr = pci_remap_cfgspace(offset, size);
3469 if (addr) {
3470 *ptr = addr;
3471 devres_add(dev, ptr);
3472 } else
3473 devres_free(ptr);
3474
3475 return addr;
3476}
3477EXPORT_SYMBOL(devm_pci_remap_cfgspace);
3478
3479/**
3480 * devm_pci_remap_cfg_resource - check, request region and ioremap cfg resource
3481 * @dev: generic device to handle the resource for
3482 * @res: configuration space resource to be handled
3483 *
3484 * Checks that a resource is a valid memory region, requests the memory
3485 * region and ioremaps with pci_remap_cfgspace() API that ensures the
3486 * proper PCI configuration space memory attributes are guaranteed.
3487 *
3488 * All operations are managed and will be undone on driver detach.
3489 *
3490 * Returns a pointer to the remapped memory or an ERR_PTR() encoded error code
3491 * on failure. Usage example:
3492 *
3493 * res = platform_get_resource(pdev, IORESOURCE_MEM, 0);
3494 * base = devm_pci_remap_cfg_resource(&pdev->dev, res);
3495 * if (IS_ERR(base))
3496 * return PTR_ERR(base);
3497 */
3498void __iomem *devm_pci_remap_cfg_resource(struct device *dev,
3499 struct resource *res)
3500{
3501 resource_size_t size;
3502 const char *name;
3503 void __iomem *dest_ptr;
3504
3505 BUG_ON(!dev);
3506
3507 if (!res || resource_type(res) != IORESOURCE_MEM) {
3508 dev_err(dev, "invalid resource\n");
3509 return IOMEM_ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
3510 }
3511
3512 size = resource_size(res);
3513 name = res->name ?: dev_name(dev);
3514
3515 if (!devm_request_mem_region(dev, res->start, size, name)) {
3516 dev_err(dev, "can't request region for resource %pR\n", res);
3517 return IOMEM_ERR_PTR(-EBUSY);
3518 }
3519
3520 dest_ptr = devm_pci_remap_cfgspace(dev, res->start, size);
3521 if (!dest_ptr) {
3522 dev_err(dev, "ioremap failed for resource %pR\n", res);
3523 devm_release_mem_region(dev, res->start, size);
3524 dest_ptr = IOMEM_ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
3525 }
3526
3527 return dest_ptr;
3528}
3529EXPORT_SYMBOL(devm_pci_remap_cfg_resource);
3530
3531static void __pci_set_master(struct pci_dev *dev, bool enable)
3532{
3533 u16 old_cmd, cmd;
3534
3535 pci_read_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, &old_cmd);
3536 if (enable)
3537 cmd = old_cmd | PCI_COMMAND_MASTER;
3538 else
3539 cmd = old_cmd & ~PCI_COMMAND_MASTER;
3540 if (cmd != old_cmd) {
3541 dev_dbg(&dev->dev, "%s bus mastering\n",
3542 enable ? "enabling" : "disabling");
3543 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, cmd);
3544 }
3545 dev->is_busmaster = enable;
3546}

3551 *
3552 * Process kernel boot arguments. This is the default implementation.
3553 * Architecture specific implementations can override this as necessary.
3554 */
3555char * __weak __init pcibios_setup(char *str)
3556{
3557 return str;
3558}
3559
3560/**
3561 * pcibios_set_master - enable PCI bus-mastering for device dev
3562 * @dev: the PCI device to enable
3563 *
3564 * Enables PCI bus-mastering for the device. This is the default
3565 * implementation. Architecture specific implementations can override
3566 * this if necessary.
3567 */
3568void __weak pcibios_set_master(struct pci_dev *dev)
3569{
3570 u8 lat;
3571
3572 /* The latency timer doesn't apply to PCIe (either Type 0 or Type 1) */
3573 if (pci_is_pcie(dev))
3574 return;
3575
3576 pci_read_config_byte(dev, PCI_LATENCY_TIMER, &lat);
3577 if (lat < 16)
3578 lat = (64 <= pcibios_max_latency) ? 64 : pcibios_max_latency;
3579 else if (lat > pcibios_max_latency)
3580 lat = pcibios_max_latency;
3581 else
3582 return;
3583
3584 pci_write_config_byte(dev, PCI_LATENCY_TIMER, lat);
3585}
3586
3587/**
3588 * pci_set_master - enables bus-mastering for device dev
3589 * @dev: the PCI device to enable
3590 *
3591 * Enables bus-mastering on the device and calls pcibios_set_master()
3592 * to do the needed arch specific settings.
3593 */
3594void pci_set_master(struct pci_dev *dev)
3595{
3596 __pci_set_master(dev, true);
3597 pcibios_set_master(dev);
3598}
3599EXPORT_SYMBOL(pci_set_master);
3600
3601/**
3602 * pci_clear_master - disables bus-mastering for device dev
3603 * @dev: the PCI device to disable
3604 */
3605void pci_clear_master(struct pci_dev *dev)
3606{
3607 __pci_set_master(dev, false);
3608}

3611/**
3612 * pci_set_cacheline_size - ensure the CACHE_LINE_SIZE register is programmed
3613 * @dev: the PCI device for which MWI is to be enabled
3614 *
3615 * Helper function for pci_set_mwi.
3616 * Originally copied from drivers/net/acenic.c.
3617 * Copyright 1998-2001 by Jes Sorensen, <jes@trained-monkey.org>.
3618 *
3619 * RETURNS: An appropriate -ERRNO error value on error, or zero for success.
3620 */
3621int pci_set_cacheline_size(struct pci_dev *dev)
3622{
3623 u8 cacheline_size;
3624
3625 if (!pci_cache_line_size)
3626 return -EINVAL;
3627
3628 /* Validate current setting: the PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE must be
3629 equal to or multiple of the right value. */
3630 pci_read_config_byte(dev, PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE, &cacheline_size);
3631 if (cacheline_size >= pci_cache_line_size &&
3632 (cacheline_size % pci_cache_line_size) == 0)
3633 return 0;
3634
3635 /* Write the correct value. */
3636 pci_write_config_byte(dev, PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE, pci_cache_line_size);
3637 /* Read it back. */
3638 pci_read_config_byte(dev, PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE, &cacheline_size);
3639 if (cacheline_size == pci_cache_line_size)
3640 return 0;
3641
3642 dev_printk(KERN_DEBUG, &dev->dev, "cache line size of %d is not supported\n",
3643 pci_cache_line_size << 2);
3644
3645 return -EINVAL;
3646}
3647EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_set_cacheline_size);
3648
3649/**
3650 * pci_set_mwi - enables memory-write-invalidate PCI transaction
3651 * @dev: the PCI device for which MWI is enabled
3652 *
3653 * Enables the Memory-Write-Invalidate transaction in %PCI_COMMAND.
3654 *
3655 * RETURNS: An appropriate -ERRNO error value on error, or zero for success.
3656 */
3657int pci_set_mwi(struct pci_dev *dev)
3658{
3659#ifdef PCI_DISABLE_MWI
3660 return 0;
3661#else
3662 int rc;
3663 u16 cmd;
3664
3665 rc = pci_set_cacheline_size(dev);
3666 if (rc)
3667 return rc;
3668
3669 pci_read_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, &cmd);
3670 if (!(cmd & PCI_COMMAND_INVALIDATE)) {
3671 dev_dbg(&dev->dev, "enabling Mem-Wr-Inval\n");
3672 cmd |= PCI_COMMAND_INVALIDATE;
3673 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, cmd);
3674 }
3675 return 0;
3676#endif
3677}
3678EXPORT_SYMBOL(pci_set_mwi);
3679
3680/**
3681 * pci_try_set_mwi - enables memory-write-invalidate PCI transaction
3682 * @dev: the PCI device for which MWI is enabled
3683 *
3684 * Enables the Memory-Write-Invalidate transaction in %PCI_COMMAND.
3685 * Callers are not required to check the return value.
3686 *
3687 * RETURNS: An appropriate -ERRNO error value on error, or zero for success.
3688 */
3689int pci_try_set_mwi(struct pci_dev *dev)
3690{
3691#ifdef PCI_DISABLE_MWI
3692 return 0;
3693#else
3694 return pci_set_mwi(dev);
3695#endif
3696}

3699/**
3700 * pci_clear_mwi - disables Memory-Write-Invalidate for device dev
3701 * @dev: the PCI device to disable
3702 *
3703 * Disables PCI Memory-Write-Invalidate transaction on the device
3704 */
3705void pci_clear_mwi(struct pci_dev *dev)
3706{

3709

3711 if (cmd & PCI_COMMAND_INVALIDATE) {
3712 cmd &= ~PCI_COMMAND_INVALIDATE;
3713 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, cmd);
3714 }
3715#endif
3716}

3719/**
3720 * pci_intx - enables/disables PCI INTx for device dev
3721 * @pdev: the PCI device to operate on
3722 * @enable: boolean: whether to enable or disable PCI INTx
3723 *
3724 * Enables/disables PCI INTx for device dev
3725 */
3726void pci_intx(struct pci_dev *pdev, int enable)
3727{
3728 u16 pci_command, new;
3729
3730 pci_read_config_word(pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &pci_command);
3731
3732 if (enable)
3733 new = pci_command & ~PCI_COMMAND_INTX_DISABLE;
3734 else
3735 new = pci_command | PCI_COMMAND_INTX_DISABLE;
3736
3737 if (new != pci_command) {
3738 struct pci_devres *dr;
3739
3740 pci_write_config_word(pdev, PCI_COMMAND, new);
3741
3742 dr = find_pci_dr(pdev);
3743 if (dr && !dr->restore_intx) {
3744 dr->restore_intx = 1;
3745 dr->orig_intx = !enable;
3746 }
3747 }
3748}
3749EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_intx);
3750
3751static bool pci_check_and_set_intx_mask(struct pci_dev *dev, bool mask)
3752{
3753 struct pci_bus *bus = dev->bus;
3754 bool mask_updated = true;
3755 u32 cmd_status_dword;
3756 u16 origcmd, newcmd;
3757 unsigned long flags;
3758 bool irq_pending;
3759
3760 /*
3761 * We do a single dword read to retrieve both command and status.
3762 * Document assumptions that make this possible.
3763 */
3764 BUILD_BUG_ON(PCI_COMMAND % 4);
3765 BUILD_BUG_ON(PCI_COMMAND + 2 != PCI_STATUS);
3766
3767 raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&pci_lock, flags);
3768
3769 bus->ops->read(bus, dev->devfn, PCI_COMMAND, 4, &cmd_status_dword);
3770
3771 irq_pending = (cmd_status_dword >> 16) & PCI_STATUS_INTERRUPT;
3772
3773 /*
3774 * Check interrupt status register to see whether our device
3775 * triggered the interrupt (when masking) or the next IRQ is
3776 * already pending (when unmasking).
3777 */
3778 if (mask != irq_pending) {
3779 mask_updated = false;
3780 goto done;
3781 }
3782
3783 origcmd = cmd_status_dword;
3784 newcmd = origcmd & ~PCI_COMMAND_INTX_DISABLE;
3785 if (mask)
3786 newcmd |= PCI_COMMAND_INTX_DISABLE;
3787 if (newcmd != origcmd)
3788 bus->ops->write(bus, dev->devfn, PCI_COMMAND, 2, newcmd);
3789
3790done:
3791 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&pci_lock, flags);
3792
3793 return mask_updated;
3794}
3795
3796/**
3797 * pci_check_and_mask_intx - mask INTx on pending interrupt
3798 * @dev: the PCI device to operate on
3799 *
3800 * Check if the device dev has its INTx line asserted, mask it and
3801 * return true in that case. False is returned if no interrupt was
3802 * pending.
3803 */
3804bool pci_check_and_mask_intx(struct pci_dev *dev)
3805{
3806 return pci_check_and_set_intx_mask(dev, true);
3807}
3808EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_check_and_mask_intx);
3809
3810/**
3811 * pci_check_and_unmask_intx - unmask INTx if no interrupt is pending
3812 * @dev: the PCI device to operate on
3813 *
3814 * Check if the device dev has its INTx line asserted, unmask it if not
3815 * and return true. False is returned and the mask remains active if
3816 * there was still an interrupt pending.
3817 */
3818bool pci_check_and_unmask_intx(struct pci_dev *dev)
3819{
3820 return pci_check_and_set_intx_mask(dev, false);
3821}
3822EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_check_and_unmask_intx);

3824/**
3825 * pci_wait_for_pending_transaction - waits for pending transaction
3826 * @dev: the PCI device to operate on
3827 *
3828 * Return 0 if transaction is pending 1 otherwise.
3829 */
3830int pci_wait_for_pending_transaction(struct pci_dev *dev)
3831{
3832 if (!pci_is_pcie(dev))
3833 return 1;
3834
3835 return pci_wait_for_pending(dev, pci_pcie_cap(dev) + PCI_EXP_DEVSTA,
3836 PCI_EXP_DEVSTA_TRPND);
3837}
3838EXPORT_SYMBOL(pci_wait_for_pending_transaction);
3839
3840static void pci_flr_wait(struct pci_dev *dev)
3841{
3842 int delay = 1, timeout = 60000;
3843 u32 id;
3844
3845 /*
3846 * Per PCIe r3.1, sec 6.6.2, a device must complete an FLR within
3847 * 100ms, but may silently discard requests while the FLR is in
3848 * progress. Wait 100ms before trying to access the device.
3849 */
3850 msleep(100);
3851
3852 /*
3853 * After 100ms, the device should not silently discard config
3854 * requests, but it may still indicate that it needs more time by
3855 * responding to them with CRS completions. The Root Port will
3856 * generally synthesize ~0 data to complete the read (except when
3857 * CRS SV is enabled and the read was for the Vendor ID; in that
3858 * case it synthesizes 0x0001 data).
3859 *
3860 * Wait for the device to return a non-CRS completion. Read the
3861 * Command register instead of Vendor ID so we don't have to
3862 * contend with the CRS SV value.
3863 */
3864 pci_read_config_dword(dev, PCI_COMMAND, &id);
3865 while (id == ~0) {
3866 if (delay > timeout) {
3867 dev_warn(&dev->dev, "not ready %dms after FLR; giving up\n",
3868 100 + delay - 1);
3869 return;
3870 }
3871
3872 if (delay > 1000)
3873 dev_info(&dev->dev, "not ready %dms after FLR; waiting\n",
3874 100 + delay - 1);
3875
3876 msleep(delay);
3877 delay *= 2;
3878 pci_read_config_dword(dev, PCI_COMMAND, &id);
3879 }
3880
3881 if (delay > 1000)
3882 dev_info(&dev->dev, "ready %dms after FLR\n", 100 + delay - 1);
3883}
3884
3885/**
3886 * pcie_has_flr - check if a device supports function level resets
3887 * @dev: device to check
3888 *
3889 * Returns true if the device advertises support for PCIe function level
3890 * resets.
3891 */
3892static bool pcie_has_flr(struct pci_dev *dev)
3893{
3894 u32 cap;
3895
3896 if (dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_FLR_RESET)
3897 return false;
3898
3899 pcie_capability_read_dword(dev, PCI_EXP_DEVCAP, &cap);
3900 return cap & PCI_EXP_DEVCAP_FLR;
3901}
3902
3903/**
3904 * pcie_flr - initiate a PCIe function level reset
3905 * @dev: device to reset
3906 *
3907 * Initiate a function level reset on @dev. The caller should ensure the
3908 * device supports FLR before calling this function, e.g. by using the
3909 * pcie_has_flr() helper.
3910 */
3911void pcie_flr(struct pci_dev *dev)
3912{
3913 if (!pci_wait_for_pending_transaction(dev))
3914 dev_err(&dev->dev, "timed out waiting for pending transaction; performing function level reset anyway\n");
3915
3916 pcie_capability_set_word(dev, PCI_EXP_DEVCTL, PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_BCR_FLR);
3917 pci_flr_wait(dev);
3918}
3919EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pcie_flr);
3920
3921static int pci_af_flr(struct pci_dev *dev, int probe)
3922{
3923 int pos;
3924 u8 cap;
3925
3926 pos = pci_find_capability(dev, PCI_CAP_ID_AF);
3927 if (!pos)
3928 return -ENOTTY;
3929
3930 if (dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_FLR_RESET)
3931 return -ENOTTY;
3932
3933 pci_read_config_byte(dev, pos + PCI_AF_CAP, &cap);
3934 if (!(cap & PCI_AF_CAP_TP) || !(cap & PCI_AF_CAP_FLR))
3935 return -ENOTTY;
3936
3937 if (probe)
3938 return 0;
3939
3940 /*
3941 * Wait for Transaction Pending bit to clear. A word-aligned test
3942 * is used, so we use the conrol offset rather than status and shift
3943 * the test bit to match.
3944 */
3945 if (!pci_wait_for_pending(dev, pos + PCI_AF_CTRL,
3946 PCI_AF_STATUS_TP << 8))
3947 dev_err(&dev->dev, "timed out waiting for pending transaction; performing AF function level reset anyway\n");
3948
3949 pci_write_config_byte(dev, pos + PCI_AF_CTRL, PCI_AF_CTRL_FLR);
3950 pci_flr_wait(dev);
3951 return 0;
3952}
3953
3954/**
3955 * pci_pm_reset - Put device into PCI_D3 and back into PCI_D0.
3956 * @dev: Device to reset.
3957 * @probe: If set, only check if the device can be reset this way.
3958 *
3959 * If @dev supports native PCI PM and its PCI_PM_CTRL_NO_SOFT_RESET flag is
3960 * unset, it will be reinitialized internally when going from PCI_D3hot to
3961 * PCI_D0. If that's the case and the device is not in a low-power state
3962 * already, force it into PCI_D3hot and back to PCI_D0, causing it to be reset.
3963 *
3964 * NOTE: This causes the caller to sleep for twice the device power transition
3965 * cooldown period, which for the D0->D3hot and D3hot->D0 transitions is 10 ms
3966 * by default (i.e. unless the @dev's d3_delay field has a different value).
3967 * Moreover, only devices in D0 can be reset by this function.
3968 */
3969static int pci_pm_reset(struct pci_dev *dev, int probe)
3970{
3971 u16 csr;
3972
3973 if (!dev->pm_cap || dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_PM_RESET)
3974 return -ENOTTY;
3975
3976 pci_read_config_word(dev, dev->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL, &csr);
3977 if (csr & PCI_PM_CTRL_NO_SOFT_RESET)
3978 return -ENOTTY;
3979
3980 if (probe)
3981 return 0;
3982
3983 if (dev->current_state != PCI_D0)
3984 return -EINVAL;
3985
3986 csr &= ~PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK;
3987 csr |= PCI_D3hot;
3988 pci_write_config_word(dev, dev->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL, csr);
3989 pci_dev_d3_sleep(dev);
3990
3991 csr &= ~PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK;
3992 csr |= PCI_D0;
3993 pci_write_config_word(dev, dev->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL, csr);
3994 pci_dev_d3_sleep(dev);
3995
3996 return 0;
3997}
3998
3999void pci_reset_secondary_bus(struct pci_dev *dev)
4000{
4001 u16 ctrl;
4002
4003 pci_read_config_word(dev, PCI_BRIDGE_CONTROL, &ctrl);
4004 ctrl |= PCI_BRIDGE_CTL_BUS_RESET;
4005 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_BRIDGE_CONTROL, ctrl);
4006 /*
4007 * PCI spec v3.0 7.6.4.2 requires minimum Trst of 1ms. Double
4008 * this to 2ms to ensure that we meet the minimum requirement.
4009 */
4010 msleep(2);
4011
4012 ctrl &= ~PCI_BRIDGE_CTL_BUS_RESET;
4013 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_BRIDGE_CONTROL, ctrl);
4014
4015 /*
4016 * Trhfa for conventional PCI is 2^25 clock cycles.
4017 * Assuming a minimum 33MHz clock this results in a 1s
4018 * delay before we can consider subordinate devices to
4019 * be re-initialized. PCIe has some ways to shorten this,
4020 * but we don't make use of them yet.
4021 */
4022 ssleep(1);
4023}
4024
4025void __weak pcibios_reset_secondary_bus(struct pci_dev *dev)
4026{
4027 pci_reset_secondary_bus(dev);
4028}
4029

4031 * pci_reset_bridge_secondary_bus - Reset the secondary bus on a PCI bridge.
4032 * @dev: Bridge device
4033 *
4034 * Use the bridge control register to assert reset on the secondary bus.
4035 * Devices on the secondary bus are left in power-on state.
4036 */
4037void pci_reset_bridge_secondary_bus(struct pci_dev *dev)
4038{
4039 pcibios_reset_secondary_bus(dev);
4040}

4042
4043static int pci_parent_bus_reset(struct pci_dev *dev, int probe)
4044{
4045 struct pci_dev *pdev;
4046
4047 if (pci_is_root_bus(dev->bus) || dev->subordinate ||
4048 !dev->bus->self || dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_BUS_RESET)
4049 return -ENOTTY;
4050
4051 list_for_each_entry(pdev, &dev->bus->devices, bus_list)
4052 if (pdev != dev)
4053 return -ENOTTY;
4054
4055 if (probe)
4056 return 0;
4057
4058 pci_reset_bridge_secondary_bus(dev->bus->self);
4059
4060 return 0;
4061}
4062
4063static int pci_reset_hotplug_slot(struct hotplug_slot *hotplug, int probe)
4064{
4065 int rc = -ENOTTY;
4066
4067 if (!hotplug || !try_module_get(hotplug->ops->owner))
4068 return rc;
4069
4070 if (hotplug->ops->reset_slot)
4071 rc = hotplug->ops->reset_slot(hotplug, probe);
4072
4073 module_put(hotplug->ops->owner);
4074
4075 return rc;
4076}
4077
4078static int pci_dev_reset_slot_function(struct pci_dev *dev, int probe)
4079{
4080 struct pci_dev *pdev;
4081
4082 if (dev->subordinate || !dev->slot ||
4083 dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_BUS_RESET)
4084 return -ENOTTY;
4085
4086 list_for_each_entry(pdev, &dev->bus->devices, bus_list)
4087 if (pdev != dev && pdev->slot == dev->slot)
4088 return -ENOTTY;
4089
4090 return pci_reset_hotplug_slot(dev->slot->hotplug, probe);
4091}
4092
4093static void pci_dev_lock(struct pci_dev *dev)
4094{
4095 pci_cfg_access_lock(dev);
4096 /* block PM suspend, driver probe, etc. */
4097 device_lock(&dev->dev);
4098}
4099
4100/* Return 1 on successful lock, 0 on contention */
4101static int pci_dev_trylock(struct pci_dev *dev)
4102{
4103 if (pci_cfg_access_trylock(dev)) {
4104 if (device_trylock(&dev->dev))
4105 return 1;
4106 pci_cfg_access_unlock(dev);
4107 }
4108
4109 return 0;
4110}
4111
4112static void pci_dev_unlock(struct pci_dev *dev)
4113{
4114 device_unlock(&dev->dev);
4115 pci_cfg_access_unlock(dev);
4116}
4117
4118static void pci_dev_save_and_disable(struct pci_dev *dev)
4119{
4120 const struct pci_error_handlers *err_handler =
4121 dev->driver ? dev->driver->err_handler : NULL;
4122
4123 /*
4124 * dev->driver->err_handler->reset_prepare() is protected against
4125 * races with ->remove() by the device lock, which must be held by
4126 * the caller.
4127 */
4128 if (err_handler && err_handler->reset_prepare)
4129 err_handler->reset_prepare(dev);
4130
4131 /*
4132 * Wake-up device prior to save. PM registers default to D0 after
4133 * reset and a simple register restore doesn't reliably return
4134 * to a non-D0 state anyway.
4135 */
4136 pci_set_power_state(dev, PCI_D0);
4137
4138 pci_save_state(dev);
4139 /*
4140 * Disable the device by clearing the Command register, except for
4141 * INTx-disable which is set. This not only disables MMIO and I/O port
4142 * BARs, but also prevents the device from being Bus Master, preventing
4143 * DMA from the device including MSI/MSI-X interrupts. For PCI 2.3
4144 * compliant devices, INTx-disable prevents legacy interrupts.
4145 */
4146 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, PCI_COMMAND_INTX_DISABLE);
4147}
4148
4149static void pci_dev_restore(struct pci_dev *dev)
4150{
4151 const struct pci_error_handlers *err_handler =
4152 dev->driver ? dev->driver->err_handler : NULL;
4153
4154 pci_restore_state(dev);
4155
4156 /*
4157 * dev->driver->err_handler->reset_done() is protected against
4158 * races with ->remove() by the device lock, which must be held by
4159 * the caller.
4160 */
4161 if (err_handler && err_handler->reset_done)
4162 err_handler->reset_done(dev);
4163}
4164
4165/**
4166 * __pci_reset_function - reset a PCI device function
4167 * @dev: PCI device to reset
4168 *
4169 * Some devices allow an individual function to be reset without affecting
4170 * other functions in the same device. The PCI device must be responsive
4171 * to PCI config space in order to use this function.
4172 *
4173 * The device function is presumed to be unused when this function is called.
4174 * Resetting the device will make the contents of PCI configuration space
4175 * random, so any caller of this must be prepared to reinitialise the
4176 * device including MSI, bus mastering, BARs, decoding IO and memory spaces,
4177 * etc.
4178 *
4179 * Returns 0 if the device function was successfully reset or negative if the
4180 * device doesn't support resetting a single function.
4181 */
4182int __pci_reset_function(struct pci_dev *dev)
4183{
4184 int ret;
4185
4186 pci_dev_lock(dev);
4187 ret = __pci_reset_function_locked(dev);
4188 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4189
4190 return ret;
4191}
4192EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(__pci_reset_function);
4193
4194/**
4195 * __pci_reset_function_locked - reset a PCI device function while holding
4196 * the @dev mutex lock.
4197 * @dev: PCI device to reset
4198 *
4199 * Some devices allow an individual function to be reset without affecting
4200 * other functions in the same device. The PCI device must be responsive
4201 * to PCI config space in order to use this function.
4202 *
4203 * The device function is presumed to be unused and the caller is holding
4204 * the device mutex lock when this function is called.
4205 * Resetting the device will make the contents of PCI configuration space
4206 * random, so any caller of this must be prepared to reinitialise the
4207 * device including MSI, bus mastering, BARs, decoding IO and memory spaces,
4208 * etc.
4209 *
4210 * Returns 0 if the device function was successfully reset or negative if the
4211 * device doesn't support resetting a single function.
4212 */
4213int __pci_reset_function_locked(struct pci_dev *dev)
4214{
4215 int rc;
4216
4217 might_sleep();
4218
4219 rc = pci_dev_specific_reset(dev, 0);
4220 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4221 return rc;
4222 if (pcie_has_flr(dev)) {
4223 pcie_flr(dev);
4224 return 0;
4225 }
4226 rc = pci_af_flr(dev, 0);
4227 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4228 return rc;
4229 rc = pci_pm_reset(dev, 0);
4230 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4231 return rc;
4232 rc = pci_dev_reset_slot_function(dev, 0);
4233 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4234 return rc;
4235 return pci_parent_bus_reset(dev, 0);
4236}
4237EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(__pci_reset_function_locked);
4238
4239/**
4240 * pci_probe_reset_function - check whether the device can be safely reset
4241 * @dev: PCI device to reset
4242 *
4243 * Some devices allow an individual function to be reset without affecting
4244 * other functions in the same device. The PCI device must be responsive
4245 * to PCI config space in order to use this function.
4246 *
4247 * Returns 0 if the device function can be reset or negative if the
4248 * device doesn't support resetting a single function.
4249 */
4250int pci_probe_reset_function(struct pci_dev *dev)
4251{
4252 int rc;
4253
4254 might_sleep();
4255
4256 rc = pci_dev_specific_reset(dev, 1);
4257 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4258 return rc;
4259 if (pcie_has_flr(dev))
4260 return 0;
4261 rc = pci_af_flr(dev, 1);
4262 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4263 return rc;
4264 rc = pci_pm_reset(dev, 1);
4265 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4266 return rc;
4267 rc = pci_dev_reset_slot_function(dev, 1);
4268 if (rc != -ENOTTY)
4269 return rc;
4270
4271 return pci_parent_bus_reset(dev, 1);
4272}
4273
4274/**
4275 * pci_reset_function - quiesce and reset a PCI device function
4276 * @dev: PCI device to reset
4277 *
4278 * Some devices allow an individual function to be reset without affecting
4279 * other functions in the same device. The PCI device must be responsive
4280 * to PCI config space in order to use this function.
4281 *
4282 * This function does not just reset the PCI portion of a device, but
4283 * clears all the state associated with the device. This function differs
4284 * from __pci_reset_function in that it saves and restores device state
4285 * over the reset.
4286 *
4287 * Returns 0 if the device function was successfully reset or negative if the
4288 * device doesn't support resetting a single function.
4289 */
4290int pci_reset_function(struct pci_dev *dev)
4291{
4292 int rc;
4293
4294 rc = pci_probe_reset_function(dev);
4295 if (rc)
4296 return rc;
4297
4298 pci_dev_lock(dev);
4299 pci_dev_save_and_disable(dev);
4300
4301 rc = __pci_reset_function_locked(dev);
4302
4303 pci_dev_restore(dev);
4304 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4305
4306 return rc;
4307}
4308EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_reset_function);
4309
4310/**
4311 * pci_reset_function_locked - quiesce and reset a PCI device function
4312 * @dev: PCI device to reset
4313 *
4314 * Some devices allow an individual function to be reset without affecting
4315 * other functions in the same device. The PCI device must be responsive
4316 * to PCI config space in order to use this function.
4317 *
4318 * This function does not just reset the PCI portion of a device, but
4319 * clears all the state associated with the device. This function differs
4320 * from __pci_reset_function() in that it saves and restores device state
4321 * over the reset. It also differs from pci_reset_function() in that it
4322 * requires the PCI device lock to be held.
4323 *
4324 * Returns 0 if the device function was successfully reset or negative if the
4325 * device doesn't support resetting a single function.
4326 */
4327int pci_reset_function_locked(struct pci_dev *dev)
4328{
4329 int rc;
4330
4331 rc = pci_probe_reset_function(dev);
4332 if (rc)
4333 return rc;
4334
4335 pci_dev_save_and_disable(dev);
4336
4337 rc = __pci_reset_function_locked(dev);
4338
4339 pci_dev_restore(dev);
4340
4341 return rc;
4342}
4343EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_reset_function_locked);
4344
4345/**
4346 * pci_try_reset_function - quiesce and reset a PCI device function
4347 * @dev: PCI device to reset
4348 *
4349 * Same as above, except return -EAGAIN if unable to lock device.
4350 */
4351int pci_try_reset_function(struct pci_dev *dev)
4352{
4353 int rc;
4354
4355 rc = pci_probe_reset_function(dev);
4356 if (rc)
4357 return rc;
4358
4359 if (!pci_dev_trylock(dev))
4360 return -EAGAIN;
4361
4362 pci_dev_save_and_disable(dev);
4363 rc = __pci_reset_function_locked(dev);
4364 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4365
4366 pci_dev_restore(dev);
4367 return rc;
4368}
4369EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_try_reset_function);
4370
4371/* Do any devices on or below this bus prevent a bus reset? */
4372static bool pci_bus_resetable(struct pci_bus *bus)
4373{
4374 struct pci_dev *dev;
4375
4376
4377 if (bus->self && (bus->self->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_BUS_RESET))
4378 return false;
4379
4380 list_for_each_entry(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4381 if (dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_BUS_RESET ||
4382 (dev->subordinate && !pci_bus_resetable(dev->subordinate)))
4383 return false;
4384 }
4385
4386 return true;
4387}
4388
4389/* Lock devices from the top of the tree down */
4390static void pci_bus_lock(struct pci_bus *bus)
4391{
4392 struct pci_dev *dev;
4393
4394 list_for_each_entry(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4395 pci_dev_lock(dev);
4396 if (dev->subordinate)
4397 pci_bus_lock(dev->subordinate);
4398 }
4399}
4400
4401/* Unlock devices from the bottom of the tree up */
4402static void pci_bus_unlock(struct pci_bus *bus)
4403{
4404 struct pci_dev *dev;
4405
4406 list_for_each_entry(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4407 if (dev->subordinate)
4408 pci_bus_unlock(dev->subordinate);
4409 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4410 }
4411}
4412
4413/* Return 1 on successful lock, 0 on contention */
4414static int pci_bus_trylock(struct pci_bus *bus)
4415{
4416 struct pci_dev *dev;
4417
4418 list_for_each_entry(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4419 if (!pci_dev_trylock(dev))
4420 goto unlock;
4421 if (dev->subordinate) {
4422 if (!pci_bus_trylock(dev->subordinate)) {
4423 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4424 goto unlock;
4425 }
4426 }
4427 }
4428 return 1;
4429
4430unlock:
4431 list_for_each_entry_continue_reverse(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4432 if (dev->subordinate)
4433 pci_bus_unlock(dev->subordinate);
4434 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4435 }
4436 return 0;
4437}
4438
4439/* Do any devices on or below this slot prevent a bus reset? */
4440static bool pci_slot_resetable(struct pci_slot *slot)
4441{
4442 struct pci_dev *dev;
4443
4444 list_for_each_entry(dev, &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4445 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4446 continue;
4447 if (dev->dev_flags & PCI_DEV_FLAGS_NO_BUS_RESET ||
4448 (dev->subordinate && !pci_bus_resetable(dev->subordinate)))
4449 return false;
4450 }
4451
4452 return true;
4453}
4454
4455/* Lock devices from the top of the tree down */
4456static void pci_slot_lock(struct pci_slot *slot)
4457{
4458 struct pci_dev *dev;
4459
4460 list_for_each_entry(dev, &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4461 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4462 continue;
4463 pci_dev_lock(dev);
4464 if (dev->subordinate)
4465 pci_bus_lock(dev->subordinate);
4466 }
4467}
4468
4469/* Unlock devices from the bottom of the tree up */
4470static void pci_slot_unlock(struct pci_slot *slot)
4471{
4472 struct pci_dev *dev;
4473
4474 list_for_each_entry(dev, &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4475 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4476 continue;
4477 if (dev->subordinate)
4478 pci_bus_unlock(dev->subordinate);
4479 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4480 }
4481}
4482
4483/* Return 1 on successful lock, 0 on contention */
4484static int pci_slot_trylock(struct pci_slot *slot)
4485{
4486 struct pci_dev *dev;
4487
4488 list_for_each_entry(dev, &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4489 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4490 continue;
4491 if (!pci_dev_trylock(dev))
4492 goto unlock;
4493 if (dev->subordinate) {
4494 if (!pci_bus_trylock(dev->subordinate)) {
4495 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4496 goto unlock;
4497 }
4498 }
4499 }
4500 return 1;
4501
4502unlock:
4503 list_for_each_entry_continue_reverse(dev,
4504 &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4505 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4506 continue;
4507 if (dev->subordinate)
4508 pci_bus_unlock(dev->subordinate);
4509 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4510 }
4511 return 0;
4512}
4513
4514/* Save and disable devices from the top of the tree down */
4515static void pci_bus_save_and_disable(struct pci_bus *bus)
4516{
4517 struct pci_dev *dev;
4518
4519 list_for_each_entry(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4520 pci_dev_lock(dev);
4521 pci_dev_save_and_disable(dev);
4522 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4523 if (dev->subordinate)
4524 pci_bus_save_and_disable(dev->subordinate);
4525 }
4526}
4527
4528/*
4529 * Restore devices from top of the tree down - parent bridges need to be
4530 * restored before we can get to subordinate devices.
4531 */
4532static void pci_bus_restore(struct pci_bus *bus)
4533{
4534 struct pci_dev *dev;
4535
4536 list_for_each_entry(dev, &bus->devices, bus_list) {
4537 pci_dev_lock(dev);
4538 pci_dev_restore(dev);
4539 pci_dev_unlock(dev);
4540 if (dev->subordinate)
4541 pci_bus_restore(dev->subordinate);
4542 }
4543}
4544
4545/* Save and disable devices from the top of the tree down */
4546static void pci_slot_save_and_disable(struct pci_slot *slot)
4547{
4548 struct pci_dev *dev;
4549
4550 list_for_each_entry(dev, &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4551 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4552 continue;
4553 pci_dev_save_and_disable(dev);
4554 if (dev->subordinate)
4555 pci_bus_save_and_disable(dev->subordinate);
4556 }
4557}
4558
4559/*
4560 * Restore devices from top of the tree down - parent bridges need to be
4561 * restored before we can get to subordinate devices.
4562 */
4563static void pci_slot_restore(struct pci_slot *slot)
4564{
4565 struct pci_dev *dev;
4566
4567 list_for_each_entry(dev, &slot->bus->devices, bus_list) {
4568 if (!dev->slot || dev->slot != slot)
4569 continue;
4570 pci_dev_restore(dev);
4571 if (dev->subordinate)
4572 pci_bus_restore(dev->subordinate);
4573 }
4574}
4575
4576static int pci_slot_reset(struct pci_slot *slot, int probe)
4577{
4578 int rc;
4579
4580 if (!slot || !pci_slot_resetable(slot))
4581 return -ENOTTY;
4582
4583 if (!probe)
4584 pci_slot_lock(slot);
4585
4586 might_sleep();
4587
4588 rc = pci_reset_hotplug_slot(slot->hotplug, probe);
4589
4590 if (!probe)
4591 pci_slot_unlock(slot);
4592
4593 return rc;
4594}

4596/**
4597 * pci_probe_reset_slot - probe whether a PCI slot can be reset
4598 * @slot: PCI slot to probe
4599 *
4600 * Return 0 if slot can be reset, negative if a slot reset is not supported.
4601 */
4602int pci_probe_reset_slot(struct pci_slot *slot)
4603{
4604 return pci_slot_reset(slot, 1);
4605}
4606EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_probe_reset_slot);
4607
4608/**
4609 * pci_reset_slot - reset a PCI slot
4610 * @slot: PCI slot to reset
4611 *
4612 * A PCI bus may host multiple slots, each slot may support a reset mechanism
4613 * independent of other slots. For instance, some slots may support slot power
4614 * control. In the case of a 1:1 bus to slot architecture, this function may
4615 * wrap the bus reset to avoid spurious slot related events such as hotplug.
4616 * Generally a slot reset should be attempted before a bus reset. All of the
4617 * function of the slot and any subordinate buses behind the slot are reset
4618 * through this function. PCI config space of all devices in the slot and
4619 * behind the slot is saved before and restored after reset.
4620 *
4621 * Return 0 on success, non-zero on error.
4622 */
4623int pci_reset_slot(struct pci_slot *slot)
4624{
4625 int rc;
4626
4627 rc = pci_slot_reset(slot, 1);
4628 if (rc)
4629 return rc;
4630
4631 pci_slot_save_and_disable(slot);
4632
4633 rc = pci_slot_reset(slot, 0);
4634
4635 pci_slot_restore(slot);
4636
4637 return rc;
4638}
4639EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_reset_slot);
4640
4641/**
4642 * pci_try_reset_slot - Try to reset a PCI slot
4643 * @slot: PCI slot to reset
4644 *
4645 * Same as above except return -EAGAIN if the slot cannot be locked
4646 */
4647int pci_try_reset_slot(struct pci_slot *slot)
4648{
4649 int rc;
4650
4651 rc = pci_slot_reset(slot, 1);
4652 if (rc)
4653 return rc;
4654
4655 pci_slot_save_and_disable(slot);
4656
4657 if (pci_slot_trylock(slot)) {
4658 might_sleep();
4659 rc = pci_reset_hotplug_slot(slot->hotplug, 0);
4660 pci_slot_unlock(slot);
4661 } else
4662 rc = -EAGAIN;
4663
4664 pci_slot_restore(slot);
4665
4666 return rc;
4667}
4668EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_try_reset_slot);

4670static int pci_bus_reset(struct pci_bus *bus, int probe)
4671{
4672 if (!bus->self || !pci_bus_resetable(bus))
4673 return -ENOTTY;
4674
4675 if (probe)
4676 return 0;
4677
4678 pci_bus_lock(bus);
4679
4680 might_sleep();
4681
4682 pci_reset_bridge_secondary_bus(bus->self);
4683
4684 pci_bus_unlock(bus);
4685
4686 return 0;
4687}

4757/**
4758 * pcix_get_max_mmrbc - get PCI-X maximum designed memory read byte count
4759 * @dev: PCI device to query
4760 *
4761 * Returns mmrbc: maximum designed memory read count in bytes
4762 * or appropriate error value.
4763 */
4764int pcix_get_max_mmrbc(struct pci_dev *dev)
4765{
4766 int cap;
4767 u32 stat;
4768
4769 cap = pci_find_capability(dev, PCI_CAP_ID_PCIX);
4770 if (!cap)
4771 return -EINVAL;
4772
4773 if (pci_read_config_dword(dev, cap + PCI_X_STATUS, &stat))
4774 return -EINVAL;
4775
4776 return 512 << ((stat & PCI_X_STATUS_MAX_READ) >> 21);
4777}
4778EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcix_get_max_mmrbc);
4779
4780/**
4781 * pcix_get_mmrbc - get PCI-X maximum memory read byte count
4782 * @dev: PCI device to query
4783 *
4784 * Returns mmrbc: maximum memory read count in bytes
4785 * or appropriate error value.
4786 */
4787int pcix_get_mmrbc(struct pci_dev *dev)
4788{
4789 int cap;
4790 u16 cmd;
4791
4792 cap = pci_find_capability(dev, PCI_CAP_ID_PCIX);
4793 if (!cap)
4794 return -EINVAL;
4795
4796 if (pci_read_config_word(dev, cap + PCI_X_CMD, &cmd))
4797 return -EINVAL;
4798
4799 return 512 << ((cmd & PCI_X_CMD_MAX_READ) >> 2);
4800}
4801EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcix_get_mmrbc);
4802
4803/**
4804 * pcix_set_mmrbc - set PCI-X maximum memory read byte count
4805 * @dev: PCI device to query
4806 * @mmrbc: maximum memory read count in bytes
4807 * valid values are 512, 1024, 2048, 4096
4808 *
4809 * If possible sets maximum memory read byte count, some bridges have erratas
4810 * that prevent this.
4811 */
4812int pcix_set_mmrbc(struct pci_dev *dev, int mmrbc)
4813{
4814 int cap;
4815 u32 stat, v, o;
4816 u16 cmd;
4817
4818 if (mmrbc < 512 || mmrbc > 4096 || !is_power_of_2(mmrbc))
4819 return -EINVAL;
4820
4821 v = ffs(mmrbc) - 10;
4822
4823 cap = pci_find_capability(dev, PCI_CAP_ID_PCIX);
4824 if (!cap)
4825 return -EINVAL;
4826
4827 if (pci_read_config_dword(dev, cap + PCI_X_STATUS, &stat))
4828 return -EINVAL;
4829
4830 if (v > (stat & PCI_X_STATUS_MAX_READ) >> 21)
4831 return -E2BIG;
4832
4833 if (pci_read_config_word(dev, cap + PCI_X_CMD, &cmd))
4834 return -EINVAL;
4835
4836 o = (cmd & PCI_X_CMD_MAX_READ) >> 2;
4837 if (o != v) {
4838 if (v > o && (dev->bus->bus_flags & PCI_BUS_FLAGS_NO_MMRBC))
4839 return -EIO;
4840
4841 cmd &= ~PCI_X_CMD_MAX_READ;
4842 cmd |= v << 2;
4843 if (pci_write_config_word(dev, cap + PCI_X_CMD, cmd))
4844 return -EIO;
4845 }
4846 return 0;
4847}
4848EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcix_set_mmrbc);
4849
4850/**
4851 * pcie_get_readrq - get PCI Express read request size
4852 * @dev: PCI device to query
4853 *
4854 * Returns maximum memory read request in bytes
4855 * or appropriate error value.
4856 */
4857int pcie_get_readrq(struct pci_dev *dev)
4858{
4859 u16 ctl;
4860
4861 pcie_capability_read_word(dev, PCI_EXP_DEVCTL, &ctl);
4862
4863 return 128 << ((ctl & PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_READRQ) >> 12);
4864}
4865EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcie_get_readrq);
4866
4867/**
4868 * pcie_set_readrq - set PCI Express maximum memory read request
4869 * @dev: PCI device to query
4870 * @rq: maximum memory read count in bytes
4871 * valid values are 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096
4872 *
4873 * If possible sets maximum memory read request in bytes
4874 */
4875int pcie_set_readrq(struct pci_dev *dev, int rq)
4876{
4877 u16 v;
4878
4879 if (rq < 128 || rq > 4096 || !is_power_of_2(rq))
4880 return -EINVAL;
4881
4882 /*
4883 * If using the "performance" PCIe config, we clamp the
4884 * read rq size to the max packet size to prevent the
4885 * host bridge generating requests larger than we can
4886 * cope with
4887 */
4888 if (pcie_bus_config == PCIE_BUS_PERFORMANCE) {
4889 int mps = pcie_get_mps(dev);
4890
4891 if (mps < rq)
4892 rq = mps;
4893 }
4894
4895 v = (ffs(rq) - 8) << 12;
4896
4897 return pcie_capability_clear_and_set_word(dev, PCI_EXP_DEVCTL,
4898 PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_READRQ, v);
4899}
4900EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcie_set_readrq);
4901
4902/**
4903 * pcie_get_mps - get PCI Express maximum payload size
4904 * @dev: PCI device to query
4905 *
4906 * Returns maximum payload size in bytes
4907 */
4908int pcie_get_mps(struct pci_dev *dev)
4909{
4910 u16 ctl;
4911
4912 pcie_capability_read_word(dev, PCI_EXP_DEVCTL, &ctl);
4913
4914 return 128 << ((ctl & PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_PAYLOAD) >> 5);
4915}
4916EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcie_get_mps);
4917
4918/**
4919 * pcie_set_mps - set PCI Express maximum payload size
4920 * @dev: PCI device to query
4921 * @mps: maximum payload size in bytes
4922 * valid values are 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096
4923 *
4924 * If possible sets maximum payload size
4925 */
4926int pcie_set_mps(struct pci_dev *dev, int mps)
4927{
4928 u16 v;
4929
4930 if (mps < 128 || mps > 4096 || !is_power_of_2(mps))
4931 return -EINVAL;
4932
4933 v = ffs(mps) - 8;
4934 if (v > dev->pcie_mpss)
4935 return -EINVAL;
4936 v <<= 5;
4937
4938 return pcie_capability_clear_and_set_word(dev, PCI_EXP_DEVCTL,
4939 PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_PAYLOAD, v);
4940}
4941EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcie_set_mps);
4942
4943/**
4944 * pcie_get_minimum_link - determine minimum link settings of a PCI device
4945 * @dev: PCI device to query
4946 * @speed: storage for minimum speed
4947 * @width: storage for minimum width
4948 *
4949 * This function will walk up the PCI device chain and determine the minimum
4950 * link width and speed of the device.
4951 */
4952int pcie_get_minimum_link(struct pci_dev *dev, enum pci_bus_speed *speed,
4953 enum pcie_link_width *width)
4954{
4955 int ret;
4956
4957 *speed = PCI_SPEED_UNKNOWN;
4958 *width = PCIE_LNK_WIDTH_UNKNOWN;
4959
4960 while (dev) {
4961 u16 lnksta;
4962 enum pci_bus_speed next_speed;
4963 enum pcie_link_width next_width;
4964
4965 ret = pcie_capability_read_word(dev, PCI_EXP_LNKSTA, &lnksta);
4966 if (ret)
4967 return ret;
4968
4969 next_speed = pcie_link_speed[lnksta & PCI_EXP_LNKSTA_CLS];
4970 next_width = (lnksta & PCI_EXP_LNKSTA_NLW) >>
4971 PCI_EXP_LNKSTA_NLW_SHIFT;
4972
4973 if (next_speed < *speed)
4974 *speed = next_speed;
4975
4976 if (next_width < *width)
4977 *width = next_width;
4978
4979 dev = dev->bus->self;
4980 }
4981
4982 return 0;
4983}
4984EXPORT_SYMBOL(pcie_get_minimum_link);
4985
4986/**
4987 * pci_select_bars - Make BAR mask from the type of resource
4988 * @dev: the PCI device for which BAR mask is made
4989 * @flags: resource type mask to be selected
4990 *
4991 * This helper routine makes bar mask from the type of resource.
4992 */
4993int pci_select_bars(struct pci_dev *dev, unsigned long flags)
4994{
4995 int i, bars = 0;
4996 for (i = 0; i < PCI_NUM_RESOURCES; i++)
4997 if (pci_resource_flags(dev, i) & flags)
4998 bars |= (1 << i);
4999 return bars;
5000}
5001EXPORT_SYMBOL(pci_select_bars);

5003/* Some architectures require additional programming to enable VGA */
5004static arch_set_vga_state_t arch_set_vga_state;
5005
5006void __init pci_register_set_vga_state(arch_set_vga_state_t func)
5007{
5008 arch_set_vga_state = func; /* NULL disables */
5009}
5010
5011static int pci_set_vga_state_arch(struct pci_dev *dev, bool decode,
5012 unsigned int command_bits, u32 flags)
5013{
5014 if (arch_set_vga_state)
5015 return arch_set_vga_state(dev, decode, command_bits,
5016 flags);
5017 return 0;
5018}
5019
5020/**
5021 * pci_set_vga_state - set VGA decode state on device and parents if requested
5022 * @dev: the PCI device
5023 * @decode: true = enable decoding, false = disable decoding
5024 * @command_bits: PCI_COMMAND_IO and/or PCI_COMMAND_MEMORY
5025 * @flags: traverse ancestors and change bridges
5026 * CHANGE_BRIDGE_ONLY / CHANGE_BRIDGE
5027 */
5028int pci_set_vga_state(struct pci_dev *dev, bool decode,
5029 unsigned int command_bits, u32 flags)
5030{
5031 struct pci_bus *bus;
5032 struct pci_dev *bridge;
5033 u16 cmd;
5034 int rc;
5035
5036 WARN_ON((flags & PCI_VGA_STATE_CHANGE_DECODES) && (command_bits & ~(PCI_COMMAND_IO|PCI_COMMAND_MEMORY)));
5037
5038 /* ARCH specific VGA enables */
5039 rc = pci_set_vga_state_arch(dev, decode, command_bits, flags);
5040 if (rc)
5041 return rc;
5042
5043 if (flags & PCI_VGA_STATE_CHANGE_DECODES) {
5044 pci_read_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, &cmd);
5045 if (decode == true)
5046 cmd |= command_bits;
5047 else
5048 cmd &= ~command_bits;
5049 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, cmd);
5050 }
5051
5052 if (!(flags & PCI_VGA_STATE_CHANGE_BRIDGE))
5053 return 0;
5054
5055 bus = dev->bus;
5056 while (bus) {
5057 bridge = bus->self;
5058 if (bridge) {
5059 pci_read_config_word(bridge, PCI_BRIDGE_CONTROL,
5060 &cmd);
5061 if (decode == true)
5062 cmd |= PCI_BRIDGE_CTL_VGA;
5063 else
5064 cmd &= ~PCI_BRIDGE_CTL_VGA;
5065 pci_write_config_word(bridge, PCI_BRIDGE_CONTROL,
5066 cmd);
5067 }
5068 bus = bus->parent;
5069 }
5070 return 0;
5071}
5072
5073/**
5074 * pci_add_dma_alias - Add a DMA devfn alias for a device
5075 * @dev: the PCI device for which alias is added
5076 * @devfn: alias slot and function
5077 *
5078 * This helper encodes 8-bit devfn as bit number in dma_alias_mask.
5079 * It should be called early, preferably as PCI fixup header quirk.
5080 */
5081void pci_add_dma_alias(struct pci_dev *dev, u8 devfn)
5082{
5083 if (!dev->dma_alias_mask)
5084 dev->dma_alias_mask = kcalloc(BITS_TO_LONGS(U8_MAX),
5085 sizeof(long), GFP_KERNEL);
5086 if (!dev->dma_alias_mask) {
5087 dev_warn(&dev->dev, "Unable to allocate DMA alias mask\n");
5088 return;
5089 }
5090
5091 set_bit(devfn, dev->dma_alias_mask);
5092 dev_info(&dev->dev, "Enabling fixed DMA alias to %02x.%d\n",
5093 PCI_SLOT(devfn), PCI_FUNC(devfn));
5094}
5095
5096bool pci_devs_are_dma_aliases(struct pci_dev *dev1, struct pci_dev *dev2)
5097{
5098 return (dev1->dma_alias_mask &&
5099 test_bit(dev2->devfn, dev1->dma_alias_mask)) ||
5100 (dev2->dma_alias_mask &&
5101 test_bit(dev1->devfn, dev2->dma_alias_mask));
5102}

5104bool pci_device_is_present(struct pci_dev *pdev)
5105{
5106 u32 v;
5107
5108 if (pci_dev_is_disconnected(pdev))
5109 return false;
5110 return pci_bus_read_dev_vendor_id(pdev->bus, pdev->devfn, &v, 0);
5111}
5112EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pci_device_is_present);

5114void pci_ignore_hotplug(struct pci_dev *dev)
5115{
5116 struct pci_dev *bridge = dev->bus->self;
5117
5118 dev->ignore_hotplug = 1;
5119 /* Propagate the "ignore hotplug" setting to the parent bridge. */
5120 if (bridge)
5121 bridge->ignore_hotplug = 1;
5122}

5124
5125resource_size_t __weak pcibios_default_alignment(void)
5126{
5127 return 0;
5128}
5129
5130#define RESOURCE_ALIGNMENT_PARAM_SIZE COMMAND_LINE_SIZE
5131static char resource_alignment_param[RESOURCE_ALIGNMENT_PARAM_SIZE] = {0};
5132static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(resource_alignment_lock);
5133
5134/**
5135 * pci_specified_resource_alignment - get resource alignment specified by user.
5136 * @dev: the PCI device to get
5137 * @resize: whether or not to change resources' size when reassigning alignment
5138 *
5139 * RETURNS: Resource alignment if it is specified.
5140 * Zero if it is not specified.
5141 */
5142static resource_size_t pci_specified_resource_alignment(struct pci_dev *dev,
5143 bool *resize)
5144{
5145 int seg, bus, slot, func, align_order, count;
5146 unsigned short vendor, device, subsystem_vendor, subsystem_device;
5147 resource_size_t align = pcibios_default_alignment();
5148 char *p;
5149
5150 spin_lock(&resource_alignment_lock);
5151 p = resource_alignment_param;
5152 if (!*p && !align)
5153 goto out;
5154 if (pci_has_flag(PCI_PROBE_ONLY)) {
5155 align = 0;
5156 pr_info_once("PCI: Ignoring requested alignments (PCI_PROBE_ONLY)\n");
5157 goto out;
5158 }
5159
5160 while (*p) {
5161 count = 0;
5162 if (sscanf(p, "%d%n", &align_order, &count) == 1 &&
5163 p[count] == '@') {
5164 p += count + 1;
5165 } else {
5166 align_order = -1;
5167 }
5168 if (strncmp(p, "pci:", 4) == 0) {
5169 /* PCI vendor/device (subvendor/subdevice) ids are specified */
5170 p += 4;
5171 if (sscanf(p, "%hx:%hx:%hx:%hx%n",
5172 &vendor, &device, &subsystem_vendor, &subsystem_device, &count) != 4) {
5173 if (sscanf(p, "%hx:%hx%n", &vendor, &device, &count) != 2) {
5174 printk(KERN_ERR "PCI: Can't parse resource_alignment parameter: pci:%s\n",
5175 p);
5176 break;
5177 }
5178 subsystem_vendor = subsystem_device = 0;
5179 }
5180 p += count;
5181 if ((!vendor || (vendor == dev->vendor)) &&
5182 (!device || (device == dev->device)) &&
5183 (!subsystem_vendor || (subsystem_vendor == dev->subsystem_vendor)) &&
5184 (!subsystem_device || (subsystem_device == dev->subsystem_device))) {
5185 *resize = true;
5186 if (align_order == -1)
5187 align = PAGE_SIZE;
5188 else
5189 align = 1 << align_order;
5190 /* Found */
5191 break;
5192 }
5193 }
5194 else {
5195 if (sscanf(p, "%x:%x:%x.%x%n",
5196 &seg, &bus, &slot, &func, &count) != 4) {
5197 seg = 0;
5198 if (sscanf(p, "%x:%x.%x%n",
5199 &bus, &slot, &func, &count) != 3) {
5200 /* Invalid format */
5201 printk(KERN_ERR "PCI: Can't parse resource_alignment parameter: %s\n",
5202 p);
5203 break;
5204 }
5205 }
5206 p += count;
5207 if (seg == pci_domain_nr(dev->bus) &&
5208 bus == dev->bus->number &&
5209 slot == PCI_SLOT(dev->devfn) &&
5210 func == PCI_FUNC(dev->devfn)) {
5211 *resize = true;
5212 if (align_order == -1)
5213 align = PAGE_SIZE;
5214 else
5215 align = 1 << align_order;
5216 /* Found */
5217 break;
5218 }
5219 }
5220 if (*p != ';' && *p != ',') {
5221 /* End of param or invalid format */
5222 break;
5223 }
5224 p++;
5225 }
5226out:
5227 spin_unlock(&resource_alignment_lock);
5228 return align;
5229}
5230
5231static void pci_request_resource_alignment(struct pci_dev *dev, int bar,
5232 resource_size_t align, bool resize)
5233{
5234 struct resource *r = &dev->resource[bar];
5235 resource_size_t size;
5236
5237 if (!(r->flags & IORESOURCE_MEM))
5238 return;
5239
5240 if (r->flags & IORESOURCE_PCI_FIXED) {
5241 dev_info(&dev->dev, "BAR%d %pR: ignoring requested alignment %#llx\n",
5242 bar, r, (unsigned long long)align);
5243 return;
5244 }
5245
5246 size = resource_size(r);
5247 if (size >= align)
5248 return;
5249
5250 /*
5251 * Increase the alignment of the resource. There are two ways we
5252 * can do this:
5253 *
5254 * 1) Increase the size of the resource. BARs are aligned on their
5255 * size, so when we reallocate space for this resource, we'll
5256 * allocate it with the larger alignment. This also prevents
5257 * assignment of any other BARs inside the alignment region, so
5258 * if we're requesting page alignment, this means no other BARs
5259 * will share the page.
5260 *
5261 * The disadvantage is that this makes the resource larger than
5262 * the hardware BAR, which may break drivers that compute things
5263 * based on the resource size, e.g., to find registers at a
5264 * fixed offset before the end of the BAR.
5265 *
5266 * 2) Retain the resource size, but use IORESOURCE_STARTALIGN and
5267 * set r->start to the desired alignment. By itself this
5268 * doesn't prevent other BARs being put inside the alignment
5269 * region, but if we realign *every* resource of every device in
5270 * the system, none of them will share an alignment region.
5271 *
5272 * When the user has requested alignment for only some devices via
5273 * the "pci=resource_alignment" argument, "resize" is true and we
5274 * use the first method. Otherwise we assume we're aligning all
5275 * devices and we use the second.
5276 */
5277
5278 dev_info(&dev->dev, "BAR%d %pR: requesting alignment to %#llx\n",
5279 bar, r, (unsigned long long)align);
5280
5281 if (resize) {
5282 r->start = 0;
5283 r->end = align - 1;
5284 } else {
5285 r->flags &= ~IORESOURCE_SIZEALIGN;
5286 r->flags |= IORESOURCE_STARTALIGN;
5287 r->start = align;
5288 r->end = r->start + size - 1;
5289 }
5290 r->flags |= IORESOURCE_UNSET;
5291}
5292
5293/*
5294 * This function disables memory decoding and releases memory resources
5295 * of the device specified by kernel's boot parameter 'pci=resource_alignment='.
5296 * It also rounds up size to specified alignment.
5297 * Later on, the kernel will assign page-aligned memory resource back
5298 * to the device.
5299 */
5300void pci_reassigndev_resource_alignment(struct pci_dev *dev)
5301{
5302 int i;
5303 struct resource *r;
5304 resource_size_t align;
5305 u16 command;
5306 bool resize = false;
5307
5308 /*
5309 * VF BARs are read-only zero according to SR-IOV spec r1.1, sec
5310 * 3.4.1.11. Their resources are allocated from the space
5311 * described by the VF BARx register in the PF's SR-IOV capability.
5312 * We can't influence their alignment here.
5313 */
5314 if (dev->is_virtfn)
5315 return;
5316
5317 /* check if specified PCI is target device to reassign */
5318 align = pci_specified_resource_alignment(dev, &resize);
5319 if (!align)
5320 return;
5321
5322 if (dev->hdr_type == PCI_HEADER_TYPE_NORMAL &&
5323 (dev->class >> 8) == PCI_CLASS_BRIDGE_HOST) {
5324 dev_warn(&dev->dev,
5325 "Can't reassign resources to host bridge.\n");
5326 return;
5327 }
5328
5329 dev_info(&dev->dev,
5330 "Disabling memory decoding and releasing memory resources.\n");
5331 pci_read_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, &command);
5332 command &= ~PCI_COMMAND_MEMORY;
5333 pci_write_config_word(dev, PCI_COMMAND, command);
5334
5335 for (i = 0; i <= PCI_ROM_RESOURCE; i++)
5336 pci_request_resource_alignment(dev, i, align, resize);
5337
5338 /*
5339 * Need to disable bridge's resource window,
5340 * to enable the kernel to reassign new resource
5341 * window later on.
5342 */
5343 if (dev->hdr_type == PCI_HEADER_TYPE_BRIDGE &&
5344 (dev->class >> 8) == PCI_CLASS_BRIDGE_PCI) {
5345 for (i = PCI_BRIDGE_RESOURCES; i < PCI_NUM_RESOURCES; i++) {
5346 r = &dev->resource[i];
5347 if (!(r->flags & IORESOURCE_MEM))
5348 continue;
5349 r->flags |= IORESOURCE_UNSET;
5350 r->end = resource_size(r) - 1;
5351 r->start = 0;
5352 }
5353 pci_disable_bridge_window(dev);
5354 }
5355}
5356
5357static ssize_t pci_set_resource_alignment_param(const char *buf, size_t count)
5358{
5359 if (count > RESOURCE_ALIGNMENT_PARAM_SIZE - 1)
5360 count = RESOURCE_ALIGNMENT_PARAM_SIZE - 1;
5361 spin_lock(&resource_alignment_lock);
5362 strncpy(resource_alignment_param, buf, count);
5363 resource_alignment_param[count] = '\0';
5364 spin_unlock(&resource_alignment_lock);
5365 return count;
5366}
5367
5368static ssize_t pci_get_resource_alignment_param(char *buf, size_t size)
5369{
5370 size_t count;
5371 spin_lock(&resource_alignment_lock);
5372 count = snprintf(buf, size, "%s", resource_alignment_param);
5373 spin_unlock(&resource_alignment_lock);
5374 return count;
5375}
5376
5377static ssize_t pci_resource_alignment_show(struct bus_type *bus, char *buf)
5378{
5379 return pci_get_resource_alignment_param(buf, PAGE_SIZE);
5380}
5381
5382static ssize_t pci_resource_alignment_store(struct bus_type *bus,
5383 const char *buf, size_t count)
5384{
5385 return pci_set_resource_alignment_param(buf, count);
5386}
5387
5388static BUS_ATTR(resource_alignment, 0644, pci_resource_alignment_show,
5389 pci_resource_alignment_store);

5391static int __init pci_resource_alignment_sysfs_init(void)
5392{
5393 return bus_create_file(&pci_bus_type,
5394 &bus_attr_resource_alignment);
5395}
5396late_initcall(pci_resource_alignment_sysfs_init);

5398static void pci_no_domains(void)
5399{
5400#ifdef CONFIG_PCI_DOMAINS
5401 pci_domains_supported = 0;
5402#endif
5403}
5404
5405#ifdef CONFIG_PCI_DOMAINS
5406static atomic_t __domain_nr = ATOMIC_INIT(-1);
5407
5408int pci_get_new_domain_nr(void)
5409{
5410 return atomic_inc_return(&__domain_nr);
5411}
5412
5413#ifdef CONFIG_PCI_DOMAINS_GENERIC
5414static int of_pci_bus_find_domain_nr(struct device *parent)
5415{
5416 static int use_dt_domains = -1;
5417 int domain = -1;
5418
5419 if (parent)
5420 domain = of_get_pci_domain_nr(parent->of_node);
5421 /*
5422 * Check DT domain and use_dt_domains values.
5423 *
5424 * If DT domain property is valid (domain >= 0) and
5425 * use_dt_domains != 0, the DT assignment is valid since this means
5426 * we have not previously allocated a domain number by using
5427 * pci_get_new_domain_nr(); we should also update use_dt_domains to
5428 * 1, to indicate that we have just assigned a domain number from
5429 * DT.
5430 *
5431 * If DT domain property value is not valid (ie domain < 0), and we
5432 * have not previously assigned a domain number from DT
5433 * (use_dt_domains != 1) we should assign a domain number by
5434 * using the:
5435 *
5436 * pci_get_new_domain_nr()
5437 *
5438 * API and update the use_dt_domains value to keep track of method we
5439 * are using to assign domain numbers (use_dt_domains = 0).
5440 *
5441 * All other combinations imply we have a platform that is trying
5442 * to mix domain numbers obtained from DT and pci_get_new_domain_nr(),
5443 * which is a recipe for domain mishandling and it is prevented by
5444 * invalidating the domain value (domain = -1) and printing a
5445 * corresponding error.
5446 */
5447 if (domain >= 0 && use_dt_domains) {
5448 use_dt_domains = 1;
5449 } else if (domain < 0 && use_dt_domains != 1) {
5450 use_dt_domains = 0;
5451 domain = pci_get_new_domain_nr();
5452 } else {
5453 dev_err(parent, "Node %pOF has inconsistent \"linux,pci-domain\" property in DT\n",
5454 parent->of_node);
5455 domain = -1;
5456 }
5457
5458 return domain;
5459}
5460
5461int pci_bus_find_domain_nr(struct pci_bus *bus, struct device *parent)
5462{
5463 return acpi_disabled ? of_pci_bus_find_domain_nr(parent) :
5464 acpi_pci_bus_find_domain_nr(bus);
5465}
5466#endif
5467#endif

5469/**
5470 * pci_ext_cfg_avail - can we access extended PCI config space?
5471 *
5472 * Returns 1 if we can access PCI extended config space (offsets
5473 * greater than 0xff). This is the default implementation. Architecture
5474 * implementations can override this.
5475 */
5476int __weak pci_ext_cfg_avail(void)
5477{
5478 return 1;
5479}

5485
5486static int __init pci_setup(char *str)
5487{
5488 while (str) {
5489 char *k = strchr(str, ',');
5490 if (k)
5491 *k++ = 0;
5492 if (*str && (str = pcibios_setup(str)) && *str) {
5493 if (!strcmp(str, "nomsi")) {
5494 pci_no_msi();
5495 } else if (!strcmp(str, "noaer")) {
5496 pci_no_aer();
5497 } else if (!strncmp(str, "realloc=", 8)) {
5498 pci_realloc_get_opt(str + 8);
5499 } else if (!strncmp(str, "realloc", 7)) {
5500 pci_realloc_get_opt("on");
5501 } else if (!strcmp(str, "nodomains")) {
5502 pci_no_domains();
5503 } else if (!strncmp(str, "noari", 5)) {
5504 pcie_ari_disabled = true;
5505 } else if (!strncmp(str, "cbiosize=", 9)) {
5506 pci_cardbus_io_size = memparse(str + 9, &str);
5507 } else if (!strncmp(str, "cbmemsize=", 10)) {
5508 pci_cardbus_mem_size = memparse(str + 10, &str);
5509 } else if (!strncmp(str, "resource_alignment=", 19)) {
5510 pci_set_resource_alignment_param(str + 19,
5511 strlen(str + 19));
5512 } else if (!strncmp(str, "ecrc=", 5)) {
5513 pcie_ecrc_get_policy(str + 5);
5514 } else if (!strncmp(str, "hpiosize=", 9)) {
5515 pci_hotplug_io_size = memparse(str + 9, &str);
5516 } else if (!strncmp(str, "hpmemsize=", 10)) {
5517 pci_hotplug_mem_size = memparse(str + 10, &str);
5518 } else if (!strncmp(str, "hpbussize=", 10)) {
5519 pci_hotplug_bus_size =
5520 simple_strtoul(str + 10, &str, 0);
5521 if (pci_hotplug_bus_size > 0xff)
5522 pci_hotplug_bus_size = DEFAULT_HOTPLUG_BUS_SIZE;
5523 } else if (!strncmp(str, "pcie_bus_tune_off", 17)) {
5524 pcie_bus_config = PCIE_BUS_TUNE_OFF;
5525 } else if (!strncmp(str, "pcie_bus_safe", 13)) {
5526 pcie_bus_config = PCIE_BUS_SAFE;
5527 } else if (!strncmp(str, "pcie_bus_perf", 13)) {
5528 pcie_bus_config = PCIE_BUS_PERFORMANCE;
5529 } else if (!strncmp(str, "pcie_bus_peer2peer", 18)) {
5530 pcie_bus_config = PCIE_BUS_PEER2PEER;
5531 } else if (!strncmp(str, "pcie_scan_all", 13)) {
5532 pci_add_flags(PCI_SCAN_ALL_PCIE_DEVS);
5533 } else {
5534 printk(KERN_ERR "PCI: Unknown option `%s'\n",
5535 str);
5536 }
5537 }
5538 str = k;
5539 }
5540 return 0;
5541}
5542early_param("pci", pci_setup);
